Near of Metro, commerce and Sightseeing places.</div><div data-reactid="326">Downtown is actually the best place to be in São Paulo city. It includes all kind of facilities like Mobility, more than 20 touristic attractions by walk, strong living, supermarkets, pharmacy, shopping, conveniences, restaurants - everything you need very near.

APARTMENT
- STUDIO with Room, Living Room, Dinner Room, Kitchen and Bathroom (see pictures)
- TWO BEDS: 01 Couple Bed + Sofa Coil Bed (Cotton bed sheets provided)
- LED Television
- High speed wireless internet
- Cable Television
- Private Bathroom with Multi temperature and High Pressure Shower (towels and hair drier provided)
- High quality furniture and appliances
- Terrace with great view
- Equiped Kitchen (freezer, stove, microwave, pots, eletric pans, etc.)</div><div data-reactid="327">NEIGHBORHOOD

SECURITY: The neighborhood is very secure. It´s an touristic  place. Has a police post office in front of the building.

MOBILITY: TAXI - you have taxi stand in front of building; SUBWAY - walk to principal lines in São Paulo: São Bento Metro (blue line | 5minutos | 400metros), Republica Metro (red line | 10minutos | 800metros) Luz Metro (yellow line | 8minutos | 600metros); BUS - many lines to all places; WALK - The neighborhood has everything you need very close.

TOURISTIC: You are in a famous Historic Place - São Paulo Downtown - You have many great attractions near the apartment. 

STRONG LIVING: You are in the heart of the largest city in Brazil. 

FACILITIES: You have supermarkets, pharmacy, shopping, conveniences, restaurants - everything you need in minutes.</div><div data-reactid="328"><li data-reactid="329"><p data-reactid="330">We had two nights in this fine apartment. data-reactid="453"><div data-reactid="454"><!-- react-text: 455 --><!-- /react-text --><div data-reactid="456">Beautiful suite with bedroom, bathroom, balcony and a veranda overlooking the bay and the hills of Valparaiso. This suite is on the third floor of a restored house that is more than 100 years old and was built with red wood from Oregon and chilean oak at the beginning of the 20th century. It is a family home that include 4 generations and diferent nationalities. 
In the morning we will bring the breakfast upstairs, so that you can enjoy the views while you get a good start into the day. 
We are in a residential and quite area 5 minutes from the Naval Museum, the Artillery elevator and the 21st of May boulevard and only 10 minutes away from the historic harbour district with excellant fish restaurants and many bars. To the more touristic centers of Concepcion and Alegre hill it is a 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes with public buses. 
There are several public transport options a few steps from the door of our house and for people who come in their own car we have a private parking place.
We offer walking tours, wine tours and visits to the museum of the chilean poet and Literature Nobel Price winner Pablo Neruda in Isla Negra, as well as excursions to the La Campana national reserve. We also provide maps and local tips and ideas to help you get the most from your stay in this fascinating UNESCO World Heritage City.
We expect your visit and will do our best to make you feel like home.</div><!-- react-text: 457 --><!-- /react-text --><div data-reactid="458"><li data-reactid="459"><p data-reactid="460">This place was so beautiful we booked an extra night. From your sitting room/breakfast room, you really feel like you are on top of the world.  The breakfasts were some of the best we had, due to the fruit or vegetables added to the standard fare of bread, cheese and meats, like avocado.  The real highlight is that you are truly living in a family home, with all the furniture, knick knacks and stuff from of a family.  The proprietress is wonderful and helpful, and really makes you feel at home.  There is plenty of hot water , if you know how the system works: don,t turn it off or down- just keep it running at a moderate pace, and if it turns cold, just point the sprayer to the floor and the warm water will return shortly.  The location of the b&amp;b is above the port area, which is fun to watch in action from the top of the closest " ascensor", about a 10 minute walk.  There are plenty of eating options in the area for lunch, but you,ll need to walk or take a cab to the restaurant areas that serve dinner.  We liked the options in the Concepción and Bella Vista neighborhoods and there is always a spectacular view to enjoy when walking back from dinner.  My husband and I try to walk as much as we can, and then took the ascensors (funiculars) so it was not a problem for us. data-reactid="581"><div data-reactid="582"><div data-reactid="583">Hob House offers you a beautiful home away from home with great hospitality and the best breakfast in town! (Highly rated on TripAdvisor) Bedrooms are en-suite. Nested in a secure neighbourhood, away from busy Nairobi. Fiber-optic internet connection is a plus. Karibu sana!</div><div data-reactid="584">Hob House is situated 15 minutes from the busy Nairobi City centre. This charming home is the perfect place to come for relaxation after exploring the city's busy life. Each bedroom is individually designed to European standards, Peter's wife who is very keen on interior design has decorated all bedrooms with great taste combining her varied backgrounds, plus all bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms. The kitchen is staffed with Kenyan cooks who are  knowledgeable in European cooking as well as many African dishes.

Our guest(s) will enjoy a home away from home, with a beautiful landscaped garden for relaxation and meditation. The surrounding area provides safe and quiet walking routes for those who like nature, as well as being only ten minutes drive to Karura Forest where you can hike for 5kms or 10kms. Hob is 10 minutes drive from three major shopping centres including; The Village Market, Westgate Mall, Sarit Centre in Westlands. And opening soon, Two Rivers Mall!

Nairobi National Park is 25 minutes drive away where the guest(s) can enjoy watching the wildlife. There is mini-bus with a driver available to ensure the guests have transport at their convenience which has daily and weekly charges. We also have reliable Taxi drivers to call whenever necessary.

There is a daily laundry service (ironing and washing) with charges.

Hob House is an experience that one can never forget as you travel to East Africa. 'Hob' mean love on Arabic means and this is what we hope you will feel when you step inside the house.

Hob house owners Kelly and Peter believe in capacity building of local youth and share 20% of room rates charged to train and empower the four staff members at Hob House.

We look forward to hosting you and bestowing on you our world class hospitality. 

Karibu sana (welcome) Hob!!</div><div data-reactid="585">Hob house overlooks corn fields and you hear the cock crow at dawn, but we are just 15 minutes from Nairobi city centre....Giving us the best of both worlds that is city and country side!</div><div data-reactid="586"><li data-reactid="587"><p data-reactid="588">I've been travelling for a month through East Africa and since I did not have reliable access to internet I failed to leave a review immediately after  I left this accommodation. Peter and his wife were fantastic hosts - warm, knowledgable, friendly - such a fantastic welcome to Kenya. They left a great impression and neither one of the accommodation we used later could measure with them. I would wholeheartedly recommend this accommodation. Hot water was an issue on our first two nights, but this was fixed for our third when we informed Peter. The house is located in a safe area, but is a little difficult/ confusing to find on (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) Maps or relay to taxi drivers as it isn't near a well-known landmark and is in a suburb that is a bit of a distance away from the city center. fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="702"><path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="704"><div data-reactid="705"><div data-reactid="706">As our guest you must make sure you have any of the fruits in season - avocados, mulberries, macadamia nuts, strawberries and locquats! Better to feast on them before the birds and the monkeys :) !!</div><div data-reactid="707">The location is in the quiet leafy outskirts of Nairobi. It is 15km (20min) away from the city centre.

The cottage has a rustic country atmosphere and the mature garden with a large variety of trees attracts all kinds of birds and it is normal to see the hadada and scared ibis busy pecking on the grass. Others include the paradise flycatchers, olive thrushes and firefinches to name a few. We occasionally get monkeys visiting because of the trees.

As our guest you must make sure you have any of the fruits in season - avocados, mulberries, macadamia nuts, strawberries and locquats! Better to feast on them before the birds and the monkeys :) !!

Nearby along the Kiambu road is the Ridgeways Mall for supermarket shopping, available also are banks,forex bureaus and restaurants. There is also Mountain Mall ,Thika Road Mall  and Garden City Mall which is larger and with more restuarants. 

The cottage has two bedrooms( Large master bedroom with Queen size bed), a shower, kitchen and a large living dining area.
It is ideal for daily, weekly short-term stays ( self catering ) or longer term rental (one month max)

SERVICES (rate-inclusive):

1) Fully furnished apartment.
2) A private fully equipped kitchen with pantry 
3) Use of the garden
4) Space for parking in the compound 
5) Security: 24hr security in the estate
6) House Cleaning every other day when accessible

 
SERVICES (rate-exclusive):

1) Airport transfers (pick-up and drop-off) 
2) Extra laundry, ironing and dry-cleaning 
3) City shopping and/or sightseeing tours 
4) Grocery shopping

Please ask for more clarification.

ATTRACTIONS
1.) Windsor Golf and Country club is about 3km away, 
2.) Paradise Lost off Kiambu road for boat riding, fishing and walking on the nature trails. 
3.) The Karura Forest is also 9km away (12min) great for weekend picnics and visit to the caves.
4.) The United Nations regional headquaters and the American Embassy in Gigiri are only about 10.5km (18min) away. 

Nairobi has great places to visit. We'll gladly assist in facilitating our guests to visit the national park, giraffe centre and the Elephant orphanage all in a day's trip!

If you have any special requests or would like more clarification, feel free to ask and we'll get back to you as soon as possible. data-reactid="832"><div data-reactid="833"><div data-reactid="834">Apartment / annexe located in a 'historic Villa surrounded by a lush countryside.
The apartment can accommodate 4 persons, and consists in a bedroom, a spacious living room with sofa bed, kitchen and bathroom.</div><div data-reactid="835">Gorgeous self-sufficient apartments, which are part of an antique regal villa. You will be immersed in nature and enjoy your privacy in the beautiful countryside of Ischia.

One bedroom apartments with private bathrooms, kitchens, and large dining rooms. You can open the double sofa bed if needed for your extra guests. All the accommodations are garden view.

The apartments have air-co, satellite tv, and there is plenty of parking space. The Villa is ideal for couples who want to forget everything stressful in life and relax on the beach and in the countryside, but it is also suitable for families with kids. In fact, the apartments are located in a green private area where guests can enjoy the nature, as well as their privacy.

The apartments lie on the hill of Barano and during the night the air gets cooler and the area quiter: you will have restfull nights!

The Villa has been built between the end of 17th century and the beginning of the 18th and it is situated on what used to be the antique canteen and residence of Cavalier Vincenzo Di Meglio.
The main road is the homonymous street which links the Villa to the lively area of Ischia Porto and the beach of Maronti, the biggest and perhaps the most beautiful on the isle.

The place has been recently renovated from the discentants of the family: they kept the original and elegant touches, typical of  the most charming houses in Ischia.
The apartments are easily reachable, and three bus lines can take you to the most attractive touristic areas.

The gardens have vegetable and fruit patches, all bio-products, if you want to try the real food of Ischia.

Included within the price for all guests to the house is a lift from the port of Ischia to the villa and return, so you will not have to carry your luggage on public transport.
Breakfast is not included, however the guests will have complimentary coffee, milk , biscuits, jam and cakes for the first day of thier stay. Please advise us in advance of any special dietary requirements, food intolerances or allergies.  

Dogs and cats are welcome here, if you respect hygiene rules and others' privacy.</div><!-- react-text: 836 --><!-- /react-text --><div data-reactid="837"><li data-reactid="838"><p data-reactid="839">This villa is unbelievable!!! GianLuigi had kept cooking essentials like olive oil, pepper, paprika, coffee, sugar, salt etc in the kitchen. That was a great help when we wanted to cook. We were welcome to take fruits from the wonderful garden. There's a bus stop 5 mins mins walk from the villa. That was very convenient. We took the bus to go visit Castello Aragnese(Do see it if you are visiting Ischia!) and Port. </p><span data-reactid="848">Radhika</span><span data-reactid="849">2015-11-25T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="850"><p data-reactid="851">Where to start. GianLugi was an absolute dream host. He picked us up at the ferry stop when we arrived and also drove us to the ferry again a week later (at 5:45 am!). He is such a lovely and easygoing guy and his villa and the apartment we stayed at was absolutely gorgeous and clean (with a spacious kitchen). The garden is filled with apricot and citrus trees and we were allowed to pick and eat whatever we wanted. One evening we all grilled vegetables from the garden (biodynamic aubergines) and ate pasta pomodoro. Ischia was such an incredible place. The villa is located in the serene area of Barano, close to the port and Maronti beach (ten minutes away by bus in opposite directions — and the bus stop is situated right outside the villa). GianLugi was more than happy to recommend places for us to go and eat and visit, but the nicest thing was his overall kindness and charming attitude. His good friend Bruno, who works with maintenance at the villa, was also a lovely guy. We can't wait to visit Villa di Meglio again. </p><span data-reactid="852">Thea</span><span data-reactid="853">2015-07-03T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="854"><p data-reactid="855">Gian Luigi is a very anticipating and joyful host who seems to enjoy to have guests at his home. He picked us up from the port by car and was also open for questions during all our stay. The house with garden is beautiful and our kid loved the mandarines growing everywhere. For us as family it was great to have a large garden around. The flat is very neat and clean and the atmosphere is cosy. Shops are close around and also restaurants. Without car you should avoid the main street because there is lot of traffic and unfortunately no sidewalk. But there are smaller streets and small lanes to discover which make a walk easier.</p><span data-reactid="856">Sarah</span><span data-reactid="857">2015-03-23T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="858"><p data-reactid="859">GianLuigi was a great owner, always ready to help us.  </div><div data-reactid="1213">Very nice suite on the second floor of a villa with fully glazed living room with sea view and green, bedroom, bathroom and large terrace around.
If necessary it's available further bedrooms and bathroom on the lower floor (1st floor). The villa is located 150 meters from the sea and 15' from Cagliari city center, reachable by bus. Cagliari offers many cultural and natural attractions, restaurants and events.
Inserted in a nice neighborhood:  the atmosphere is lovely and quiet, friendly nature and mild climate, sea, beach. You can find culture, art, archeology, natural habitat . Easily accessible beaches along the coast from Cagliari to Villasimius and Costa Rey. The house provides services such as ADSL, air conditioning and a typical Sardinian hospitality. Can be collected and reserved, how to deal with a family of children and adults.
The minimalist style villa has been restored (Class A) and is set on 3 levels above ground and a basement. Terraces, views, garden with plenty of space, the pool particularly pretty, available during normal business hours.
Breakfast is included in the rate. The suite contains a microwave and refrigerator. For long stays, as well as convivial, services are available as lavandera, bicycles and even cars if necessary.

For any suggestion or question, please contact us. You can see more details and pictures looking for villa Crespellani of which there is also a 3D model that allows you to visit the house and explore the architecture.
Carlo &amp; Luisella

data-reactid="1456"><div class="spacing_501y9d-o_O-oddSpacing_y3jo3z" data-reactid="1457"><div class="listingCardWrapper_9kg52c" data-reactid="1458"><div id="listing-326033" fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="1467"><path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1469"><div data-reactid="1470"><div data-reactid="1471">We are located where 145acres of Jungle meet a turquoise Lagoon.On the southern tip of remote Isla Cristobal, an island without roads, you are sure to feel submerged in nature.With 5 accommodations lining the waterfront, we encourage visitors to snorkel our half-mile reef.A Jungle Lodge offers a 180 degree view of the Tierra Oscurra Lagoon,a dorm-style room for large groups, and roof-top patio for yoga sessions or business meetings. On our common dock over the water we offer a full meal service.</div><div data-reactid="1472">The island San Cristobal has no roads, trails, or electricity, but we have solar panels, rainwater collection, and wifi to ease our guests into off the grid living. A boat ride to and from the property is included in the fee. 

The entire property is reserve-able when you book for 10 or more guests. We have a variety of cabins here to accommodate your large group. 

Along the water front are 4 cabins and 1 house. 

The Reef Cabin perched atop the island's coral reef, offers two private bedrooms , The Sunrise Room which has a king sized bed, and The Diving Board Room which has a queen size.  These Cabins sit above the Kitchen and the common space, where meal services are provided. On this deck there is also a fresh water shower (biodegradable soap only, please!) the composting toilet is a 2 minute walk, on the land. 

For seperate bookings of the Reef Cabin Rooms only please see: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/919910 
or
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1129768

On the water front as well we have a floating cabana with a queen sized bed and a king sized bed in the The Hidden Treasure Cabin, on stilts over the water. 

For separate bookings of the Floating Cabana please see:
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/9372808

For separate bookings of the Hidden Treasure Cabin please see:
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10702129

The house on the waterfront, the Dreamy Mangrove Treehouse, has 1 king sized bed and a convertable king sized couch in the livingroom. It has its own kitchen and composting toilet and an outdoor shower. 

For separate bookings of the Dreamy Mangrove Treehouse please see:
https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15160244

The House up on the hill is made completely with lumber grown on site, and has a 180 degree view of the Tierra Oscura Lagoon.   It has a master bedroom with a king sized bed; a screened-in loft space with 3 queen sized beds, which can be converted into a yoga studio or meeting space, and  a basement dorm with 3 beds. This house has a septic system with a shower and 2 flushing toilets and a full kitchen.  

Clean linens and towels are provided for all guests. 

Meal services are offered on the dock, but spices, cooking oils, rice, and other kitchen basics are provided for your use, should you want to cook for yourselves, along with fresh young coconut juice, bananas, and other fresh goods from the property. (Cilantro, lemongrass, and citruses all grow around the Hill House!)

Tours are also available to neighboring beaches, rivers and towns, pricing varies by the number of guests.  Round trip boat ride will take you to the town of Bocas del Toro, or Old Bank on Bastimentos, which have many bars and restaurants, a fun backpacker party scene, some very good food, some not-so-good food, an airport, several small supermarkets, local fruit and vegetable stands, and lots of local color and diversity. A similar boat trip will take you to the mainland (Almirante), a jumping off point for extended trips to Panama's incredible cloud forest or Costa Rica. We also offer tours to neighboring beaches and National parks, Zapatillas islands, Red Frog Beach and Starfish Beach are the most famous. 

Bring your bug spray, your hiking boots, and your bathing suit! It's tropical adventure time!


!!! IMPORTANT: THIS IS A RUSTIC PLACE, NOT A RESORT !!!  

It's for the adventurous, who want reasonable comfort in a remote setting, and want to experience realities of rural life in the tropics. In addition to the abundant pleasures of the lush forests and reefs, you should expect to…..

GO OFF GRID: You will run out of running water if you take long showers or if the rains don't come. The solar panels are backed by a generator, but you'll need to remember to turn off lights and fans when not in use — especially when the clouds hang out for a few days. 

WEAR BUG PROTECTION: We are bug conscious in the design of our accommodations.  You will see dozens of geckos feeding on the insects on the outside of the screens that keep you nice and relatively bug free in the house. That being said, a layer of coconut oil, or bug spray can keep you comfortable during "Chitra Hour" when the no-see-ums come out at dawn and dusk. These critters are generally predictable, so its easy to be prepared.</div><div data-reactid="1473">This neighborhood is WILD! 

You really  become PART of the eco-system when you stay at The Tropical Island Jungle Retreat. 

We take sharing this paradise very seriously and we want to keep it comfortable for our animal neighbors too. The Fish, the Dolphins, the Sloths, the Howler Monkeys, the Herons, the Parrots, the kinkajous and the Iguanas were all here before us, and luckily still are.  Please remember to bring bio-degradable soaps and bug sprays, and to be conscious of the trash you bring on site.</div><div data-reactid="1474"><li data-reactid="1475"><p data-reactid="1476">I'm a traveler, and I know the area moderately. I scoped out Ulrich's spot as a place to send my best friends on their honeymoon this winter. WOW. The pictures don't do it justice.  It's a great location. Details matter down here and this guy knows what he's doing. He picked a spot that has everything, including BIOLUMINESCENT ocean water (you know, sparkles like Avatar when you swim at night??... I'm not kidding), fruit trees, coral reef, and a naturally low insect load. I can tell you from personal experience that you will find properties around here that are sand flea hell.  His accommodations are high up on the hill and out over the water on a causeway, and the paths in between are clear of brush (there is literally a walkway lined with palm trees on either side).  He was smart about where he put waste, septic and compost, he has twice as many solar panels (24) and water tanks (6 giant) as nearby places.  These are all things you WONT notice, because your stay will be comfortable, and you'll be relaxing in a hammock and not running out of power and water.  Another mark of respect, the locals that live on a small house on the property are great people, and actually like him (they were bringing up fruit and presents, chatting us up, making coconut oil, and coconut water in the mornings and even speaking some English). He used traditional joinery and construction techniques where possible and hand hewn natural braces and trusses in the architecture.  I am so impressed with this guy, he is clearly a great human.  Definitely excited to send my friends Jim and Chante down here for their honeymoon :)</p><span data-reactid="1477">Cameron</span><span data-reactid="1478">2012-07-20T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1479"><p data-reactid="1480">Great host and great place to stay! This place is not a resort, but a cosy, close to nature, jungle &amp; island experience. Way better than any package holiday or boutique hotel.   The host(s) were really friendly and had great cooking skillls.   The hillhouse had plenty of space and the overwater dock was a great place to chill.  Higly recommended!</p><span data-reactid="1481">Jan</span><span data-reactid="1482">2014-07-07T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1483"><p data-reactid="1484">This place is crazy awesome. The pictures of the reef under the dock ain't no lie - there really is amazing snorkeling and dolphins passing right by the boat house. Caretakers Leo, Dorien &amp; Lazare are great. Considering how remote we are, the hill house is surprisingly well outfitted and bugproofed, and the Internet is fast and reliable.    You couldn't find a truer Bocas experience. We just got here but we like it so much, we're staying 3 months!</p><span data-reactid="1485">Sarah</span><span data-reactid="1486">2013-09-15T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1487"><p data-reactid="1488">A vibrant coral reef RIGHT ON THE PREMISES.  And get this, bioluminescent water at night.  But wait..there's more!  The host, Lazare, was approachable, kind, intelligent, and consistently inconvenienced himself to make sure his guests had the utmost experience on, and off of, the island.  Hands down, it's worth the trip to Panama just to meet him, seriously.  I hope he and his friends will visit us in New York City.  The Hill House had spectacular views, a wide array of books, spacious rooms, and excellent Internet connection.  But it's about the community and joy that this place brings out in people that was truly remarkable.  This was HANDS DOWN THE BEST airbnb experience.  Bravo!  </p><span data-reactid="1489">Jeremiah</span><span data-reactid="1490">2015-12-20T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1491"><p data-reactid="1492">Lazare has been a very nice and incredibly helpful host throughout the whole duration of our stay (8 days). He is knowledgeable of the local flora and fauna, as well as the places to visit around Cristobal Island. He's resourceful and always willing to help, crossing the boundary of the typical exchange you'd expect in a professional setting, it felt more like spending the week with a friend.  The island itself is quite magical, with the temperature of the water about the same as the surrounding atmosphere. As Cristobal is located in a bay, the stillness of the water reflects like glass and allows you to see right to the bottom of the exotic reef. At night, the water on the reef glows with bioluminescence (when excited via movement) and feels a bit like swimming through the night sky. It rained daily, as it was the rainy season — but the rain was mostly concentrated from 3am-9am and lowered the temperature nicely.    Pro tip: washing clothes. The air is so humid that they'll never dry off completely if you just hang them somewhere, make sure you expose them to the sun whenever it's shining.    Lazare took us on a rigorous hike of the island where we ate from the land guanabana fruit (a gigantic one, we quite literally stuffed our faces in it), cocoa, fresh limes and cilantro with a machete clearing our path. We kayaked across the bay for $1 beers and $2 chicken, where the local children found us terribly amusing. Ulrich has constructed an impressive off the grid paradise, which really led us to be conscious of our water and electricity use.    It's a rustic experience, but a unique oasis for the adventurous and sustainability minded.     Keep in mind: you're in the jungle. Expect jungle fauna. Beatles, cockroaches, dragon moths, and yes, even tarantulas (we found one in the house crawling just beside out feet), opossums, and parrots will be part of your daily routine. If you're freaked out by one of them, look for something else. If you don't mind having an authentic tropical jungle experience, then this is definitely the place for you.</p><span data-reactid="1493">Federico</span><span data-reactid="1494">2014-05-04T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1495"><p data-reactid="1496">What an amazing place!  I was planning to stay in the hill house, but when I asked to stay instead in his cute little floating cabin (not pictured) instead, he said no problem and had it ready right away!  He and Jody are sweet, helpful hosts and their meals are very tasty.  There is gorgeous property to hike around, Dolphin Bay is an easy (hour-ish) kayak trip away, and the coral garden is feet from the dock and makes for good snorkeling.  Previous comments are right: this is not like a luxury hotel- be sure you're ok with rainwater showers,  little geckos, and bugs.  If you are then this jungle experience will be a great one for you.</p><span data-reactid="1497">Clair</span><span data-reactid="1498">2015-05-25T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1499"><p data-reactid="1500">I am a pretty experienced traveller who visited more than 50 countries backpacking, for business and vacation with family.    I am impressed with the comfort Ulrich has been able to bring to such a remote and nature intense location. 3KW of solar panels, drinking water in a quantity to let 8 people take shower, clean cloths and cook without problems. A good internet connection though a wifi bridge to the continent. Daily cleaning service and a boat driver to take you around the islands looking for great beaches, dolphins (many!) or simply exploring.    The location is also very good for snorkelling (note that underwater visibility in Bocas is never excellent, but the corals are great) and safe swimming.     We stayed there with 4 friends and our 2 kids (3 years old and 1 year old).  The water house is not the place where you would leave them alone if they don't know how to swim. We end up by taking the boat to go to close beaches during the day and that worked very well.     You can keep insects out of the house easily if you manage the nets and lights correctly. But if you are too much scared about bugs, this is probably not the right place for you.      I strongly recommend this place to any world traveller looking for great nature, privacy and good conforts. I recommend to read Ulrich notes very well because it helps you understand how to take the most from your stay.    Thank you Ulrich for the great experience!</p><span data-reactid="1501">Marco</span><span data-reactid="1502">2012-08-18T00:00:00Z</span></li><li data-reactid="1503"><p data-reactid="1504">The reservation was canceled 42 days before arrival. data-reactid="2103"><div data-reactid="2104"><div data-reactid="2105">Private room with an en suite bathroom and a beautiful sea view.

The private room is conveniently located in central area, very safe, and yet less then 10 minutes of walk from everything; center (Diocletian palace), Bus station,Ferries,beaches, Marjan forest, ACI Marina and Poljud stadium (Ultra festival).</div><div data-reactid="2106">Private room with a beautiful view on the main harbor and ACI marina.
 In front there is a big park and a parking lot where you can park your car safely and for free.


It consists of spacious en suite bathroom with tub and shower, and sleeping room with a king size double bed.

facilities are : 
- Air condition 
-Free WI-FI (wireless internet)
- washing machine
- hairdryer
-TV
- towels and linen included in price
- city tax included in price

The house is in a very central position in the first line by the sea, with a great view on the city harbor and the surrounding islands.

One of the most famous Split restaurant FIFE is located in the building across the street and a well equipped supermarket is just next door.

If you're coming with a car there are loads of city parking spaces in the vicinity of the house , and most of the city rent a car offices are in the 100 meters radius.

If coming by bus/train/ferry it's a 10 minutes walking distance as all of the stations are located in the city ferry station.

Diocletian's palace is just 5 minutes walking distance.

We can store your bags when you check out if you want to take day trips so you don't have to carry all of your luggage.</div><div data-reactid="2107">House is located at the end of the main promenade in Split, The Riva. It's a lively area filled with bars and restaurants, the main sightseeing area The Diocletians Palace is less than 5 minutes walk from the house.
This neighborhood is considered one of the best in Split because it is a 10 min. walk from the Diocletian's Palace and center, 5 min.ACI MARINA and from forest hill Marjan which is surrounded with beautiful beaches, all different, tracks for running biking, walking, climbing, tennis, medieval churches, views that takes your breath away.... and it has a lot of parks and green areas with a free parking spaces. Several markets, groceries are located in the neighborhood as well as local green market where people from villages around Split bring freshly grown food and sell it.</div><div data-reactid="2108"><li data-reactid="2109"><p data-reactid="2110">This was the perfect place to stay. class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2230"><div data-reactid="2231"><div data-reactid="2232">Fantastic sun filled studio apartment in the heart of Bondi, 2 minutes to everything, plunge into the bondi lifestyle then come back and relax in the sunshine on the daybed.</div><div data-reactid="2233">Large and very light luxury studio apartment in the heart of bondi, 1 minute to main street (Hall st) and 4 minutes to beach.  Surrounded by great cafes, bars and restaurants.  The perfect location in which to experience the Bondi LIfestyle.  Walk the coastal path, take a swim and sauna at Icebergs pool, have a cold beer with fish and chips by the Beach at The Bucket List.

Apartment is modern and incredibly light year round as on top floor with large North West facing balcony. In security building with elevator.  Great coffee shop downstairs. THIS IS A NON SMOKING APARTMENT, NO SMOKING INSIDE OR ON THE DECK.

Relax on the daybed on the huge deck surrounded by mature fruit trees and greenery.  Or meditate in the spooky serenity of the egg chair....

Apartment comes with free wifi, TV, internal washing machine &amp; dryer, reverse cycle air con, kitchen, fridge, kettle, plates, cutlery glasses, iron, hair dryer, etc.  Fresh bed linen and towels are provided.

Large modern bathroom with power shower.

Unit is furnished with designer furniture, two seat Corbusier leather sofa, designer egg chair and teardrop coffee table, complemented by Brazilian cow hide rug.

A great place to explore Bondi and live the lifestyle.

Queen Bed
2 seat Brand new leather sofa (not one shown in photos, is a lot more comfortable!)
Egg chair
Reverse Cycle Air Conditioning
Free ADSL2 Wireless Internet
TV (I put in a TV after pictures were taken)
Harman Kardon Soundsticks powered speakers for great sounding music from any device with a headphone socket. 
Table/Desk with two chairs
Cookware &amp; Kitchen utensils, including olive oil, balsamic, salt &amp; pepper
Towels and Bed Linen provided
Kettle, toaster, pots, pans and utensils
Iron and Ironing board
Hairdryer
Gas hob and oven
Small Bar Fridge
Brazilian Cowhide rug
Outdoor solid wood two seater table and chairs
Large solid wood Daybed 
Large deck with fruit trees and powered sun awning
Washing Machine and tumble dryer (powder provided)
Modern bathroom with Power Shower.

We are available to answer any queries that may arise.

Bondi has everything for a great holiday, world famous beach, great cafe's and restaurants on your doorstep and easy access to explore the rest of Sydney.  Go crazy or just chill out.

The 389 bus to Bondi Junction (for trains) stops outside and its a short walk (3 minutes) to Campbell Parade for buses to the city (333).

Check in is 2pm, Check out is 10am (late checkout by arrangement if no guests coming in that day)

Keys will be in a key safe, code provided on accepted booking.

PARKING - there is no off street parking at apartment.  Outside is timed and paid, a few blocks away (anywhere north of Blair st) is untimed parking.  I advise parking in untimed areas.

FOR CHRISTMAS BOOKING you must book for at least 7 days ending on 28th dec.</div><div data-reactid="2234">Bondi has everything for a great holiday, world famous beach, great cafe's and restaurants on your doorstep and easy access to explore the rest of Sydney. this paradise very seriously and we want to keep it comfortable for our animal neighbors too. The Fish, the Dolphins, the Sloths, the Howler Monkeys, the Herons, the Parrots, the kinkajous and the Iguanas were all here before us, and luckily still are.  Please remember to bring bio-degradable soaps and bug sprays, and to be conscious of the trash you bring on site.","picture_url":"https://a0.muscache.com/im/pictures/1409f84a-1fd6-4c2b-bce0-32b3283578a3.jpg?aki_policy=large","property_type":"Island","public_address":"Cristóbal Island, Bocas del Toro, Panama","seo_reviews":[{"reviewer_first_name":"Cameron","comments":"I'm a traveler, and I know the area moderately. I scoped out Ulrich's spot as a place to send my best friends on their honeymoon this winter. WOW. The pictures don't do it justice.  It's a great location. Details matter down here and this guy knows what he's doing. He picked a spot that has everything, including BIOLUMINESCENT ocean water (you know, sparkles like Avatar when you swim at night??... I'm not kidding), fruit trees, coral reef, and a naturally low insect load. I can tell you from personal experience that you will find properties around here that are sand flea hell.  His accommodations are high up on the hill and out over the water on a causeway, and the paths in between are clear of brush (there is literally a walkway lined with palm trees on either side).  He was smart about where he put waste, septic and compost, he has twice as many solar panels (24) and water tanks (6 giant) as nearby places.  These are all things you WONT notice, because your stay will be comfortable, and you'll be relaxing in a hammock and not running out of power and water.  Another mark of respect, the locals that live on a small house on the property are great people, and actually like him (they were bringing up fruit and presents, chatting us up, making coconut oil, and coconut water in the mornings and even speaking some English). He used traditional joinery and construction techniques where possible and hand hewn natural braces and trusses in the architecture.  I am so impressed with this guy, he is clearly a great human. ","reviewer_image_url":"https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/21461240/profile_pic/1424125351/original.jpg?aki_policy=x_medium","created_at":"2015-12-20T00:00:00Z"},{"reviewer_first_name":"Federico","comments":"Lazare has been a very nice and incredibly helpful host throughout the whole duration of our stay (8 days). He is knowledgeable of the local flora and fauna, as well as the places to visit around Cristobal Island. He's resourceful and always willing to help, crossing the boundary of the typical exchange you'd expect in a professional setting, it felt more like spending the week with a friend.  The island itself is quite magical, with the temperature of the water about the same as the surrounding atmosphere. As Cristobal is located in a bay, the stillness of the water reflects like glass and allows you to see right to the bottom of the exotic reef. At night, the water on the reef glows with bioluminescence (when excited via movement) and feels a bit like swimming through the night sky. It rained daily, as it was the rainy season — but the rain was mostly concentrated from 3am-9am and lowered the temperature nicely.    Pro tip: washing clothes. The air is so humid that they'll never dry off completely if you just hang them somewhere, make sure you expose them to the sun whenever it's shining.    Lazare took us on a rigorous hike of the island where we ate from the land guanabana fruit (a gigantic one, we quite literally stuffed our faces in it), cocoa, fresh limes and cilantro with a machete clearing our path. We kayaked across the bay for $1 beers and $2 chicken, where the local children found us terribly amusing. Ulrich has constructed an impressive off the grid paradise, which really led us to be conscious of our water and electricity use.    It's a rustic experience, but a unique oasis for the adventurous and sustainability minded.     Keep in mind: you're in the jungle. Expect jungle fauna. Beatles, cockroaches, dragon moths, and yes, even tarantulas (we found one in the house crawling just beside out feet), opossums, and parrots will be part of your daily routine. If you're freaked out by one of them, look for something else. If you don't mind having an authentic tropical jungle experience, then this is definitely the place for you.","reviewer_image_url":"https://a0.muscache.com/im/users/4950905/profile_pic/1406764173/original.jpg?aki_policy=x_medium","created_at":"2014-05-04T00:00:00Z"},{"reviewer_first_name":"Clair","comments":"What an amazing place! I am impressed with the comfort Ulrich has been able to bring to such a remote and nature intense location. 3KW of solar panels, drinking water in a quantity to let 8 people take shower, clean cloths and cook without problems. A good internet connection though a wifi bridge to the continent. Daily cleaning service and a boat driver to take you around the islands looking for great beaches, dolphins (many!) or simply exploring.    The location is also very good for snorkelling (note that underwater visibility in Bocas is never excellent, but the corals are great) and safe swimming.     We stayed there with 4 friends and our 2 kids (3 years old and 1 year old).  The water house is not the place where you would leave them alone if they don't know how to swim. We end up by taking the boat to go to close beaches during the day and that worked very well.     You can keep insects out of the house easily if you manage the nets and lights correctly. But if you are too much scared about bugs, this is probably not the right place for you.      I strongly recommend this place to any world traveller looking for great nature, privacy and good conforts. I recommend to read Ulrich notes very well because it helps you understand how to take the most from your stay. We have a variety of cabins here to accommodate your large group. \n\nAlong the water front are 4 cabins and 1 house. \n\nThe Reef Cabin perched atop the island's coral reef, offers two private bedrooms , The Sunrise Room which has a king sized bed, and The Diving Board Room which has a queen size.  These Cabins sit above the Kitchen and the common space, where meal services are provided. On this deck there is also a fresh water shower (biodegradable soap only, please!) the composting toilet is a 2 minute walk, on the land. \n\nFor seperate bookings of the Reef Cabin Rooms only please see: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/919910 \nor\nhttps://www.airbnb.com/rooms/1129768\n\nOn the water front as well we have a floating cabana with a queen sized bed and a king sized bed in the The Hidden Treasure Cabin, on stilts over the water. \n\nFor separate bookings of the Floating Cabana please see:\nhttps://www.airbnb.com/rooms/9372808\n\nFor separate bookings of the Hidden Treasure Cabin please see:\nhttps://www.airbnb.com/rooms/10702129\n\nThe house on the waterfront, the Dreamy Mangrove Treehouse, has 1 king sized bed and a convertable king sized couch in the livingroom. It has its own kitchen and composting toilet and an outdoor shower. \n\nFor separate bookings of the Dreamy Mangrove Treehouse please see:\nhttps://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15160244\n\nThe House up on the hill is made completely with lumber grown on site, and has a 180 degree view of the Tierra Oscura Lagoon.   It has a master bedroom with a king sized bed; a screened-in loft space with 3 queen sized beds, which can be converted into a yoga studio or meeting space, and  a basement dorm with 3 beds. This house has a septic system with a shower and 2 flushing toilets and a full kitchen.  \n\nClean linens and towels are provided for all guests. \n\nMeal services are offered on the dock, but spices, cooking oils, rice, and other kitchen basics are provided for your use, should you want to cook for yourselves, along with fresh young coconut juice, bananas, and other fresh goods from the property. (Cilantro, lemongrass, and citruses all grow around the Hill House!)\n\nTours are also available to neighboring beaches, rivers and towns, pricing varies by the number of guests.  Round trip boat ride will take you to the town of Bocas del Toro, or Old Bank on Bastimentos, which have many bars and restaurants, a fun backpacker party scene, some very good food, some not-so-good food, an airport, several small supermarkets, local fruit and vegetable stands, and lots of local color and diversity. A similar boat trip will take you to the mainland (Almirante), a jumping off point for extended trips to Panama's incredible cloud forest or Costa Rica. We also offer tours to neighboring beaches and National parks, Zapatillas islands, Red Frog Beach and Starfish Beach are the most famous. \n\nBring your bug spray, your hiking boots, and your bathing suit! It's tropical adventure time!\n\n\n!!! IMPORTANT: THIS IS A RUSTIC PLACE, NOT A RESORT !!!  \n\nIt's for the adventurous, who want reasonable comfort in a remote setting, and want to experience realities of rural life in the tropics. In addition to the abundant pleasures of the lush forests and reefs, you should expect to…..\n\nGO OFF GRID: You will run out of running water if you take long showers or if the rains don't come. The solar panels are backed by a generator, but you'll need to remember to turn off lights and fans when not in use — especially when the clouds hang out for a few days. \n\nWEAR BUG PROTECTION: We are bug conscious in the design of our accommodations.  You will see dozens of geckos feeding on the insects on the outside of the screens that keep you nice and relatively bug free in the house. That being said, a layer of coconut oil, or bug spray can keep you comfortable during \"Chitra Hour\" when the no-see-ums come out at dawn and dusk. These critters are generally predictable, so its easy to be prepared.","summary":"We are located where 145acres of Jungle meet a turquoise Lagoon.On the southern tip of remote Isla Cristobal, an island without roads, you are sure to feel submerged in nature.With 5 accommodations lining the waterfront, we encourage visitors to snorkel our half-mile reef.A Jungle Lodge offers a 180 degree view of the Tierra Oscurra Lagoon,a dorm-style room for large groups, and roof-top patio for yoga sessions or business meetings. One of a kind.  The house is beautifully planned and immaculately finished.  We hired both units for two weeks to enjoy a holiday with friends and family (with numbers peaking at 6 adults and 2 children).  The separation of the units works well with each independent but easily combining for meals, sunning on the terrace etc.  Stunning views from the upper terrace during the day followed by star-gazing at night.  The plunge pool provides welcome relief from the heat of the day although the house almost always catches the breeze (with plenty of shade for those who want to keep out of the sun).  It was significantly cooler than nearby Fethiye.  Kağan and Bilgiseven gave us the warmest of welcomes and a fridge stocked with local delicacies.  The local farmer provided delicious eggs.
